description: From Middle French presentable, from Old French, as if present +â€Ž -able.

adjectives.description: presentable (comparative more presentable, superlative most presentable)

entries.meaning: In good enough shape to be shown or offered to other people; tidy; attractive.
examples: Before we go out, let me just go to the washroom and make myself presentable.

entries.meaning: (ecclesiastical) Capable of being presented to a church living.
